summary:
The Security Council,
 Reaffirming support for Burundi's Peace and Reconciliation Agreement (Arusha, 28 August 2000),
 Convinced of the need to establish the truth, investigate crimes, and bring to justice those responsible for genocide, crimes against humanity, and war crimes in Burundi since independence,
 Emphasizing the need for international assistance to help Burundi end impunity, promote reconciliation, and establish a society under the rule of law,
 Noting the request by former President Pierre Buyoya (24 July 2002) for an international judicial commission of inquiry,
 Noting the Secretary-General's report (11 March 2005) on the assessment mission to Burundi (16-24 May 2004),
 Having heard the Transitional Government's opinion on the recommendations,
1. Requests the Secretary-General to initiate negotiations with the Government and consultations with all Burundian parties concerned on how to implement his recommendations, and to report to the Council by 30 September 2005 on details of implementation, including costs, structures and time frame;
2. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
